entry.title: Nimby Nation: Debunking the Stigma
entry.summary: In the world today, there are several noteworthy events taking place. Firstly, there is a discussion surrounding the concept of being a Nimby (Not In My Backyard) and whether it is truly a negative thing. This topic is being explored in the This is Money podcast. Additionally, a new trend called "ghost charging" has emerged among electric vehicle (EV) owners, with half of them utilizing it to gain priority. This innovative method is being examined and its implications are being discussed. In other news, an Indian student team has achieved a remarkable feat by securing the fourth rank in the International Mathematics Olympiad, marking their best-ever performance. This achievement highlights the talent and dedication of these students. On the corporate front, UltraTech Cement has reported weak results for the first quarter, but improvement is expected in the second half of the fiscal year 2025, according to IDBI Capital. Similarly, Polycab India's first-quarter results indicate resilient domestic demand, as analyzed by Dolat Capital. Moving on, the Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) has set an ambitious goal of becoming a "One Trillion Dollar Giant" by 2047, as stated by its Chairman. This aspiration showcases the company's long-term vision and determination. Lastly, foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have infused a significant amount of Rs 30,772 crore in equity investments in July so far, indicating their confidence in the Indian market. This influx of funds is expected to have a positive impact on the economy. These diverse events highlight the various developments and achievements taking place in different sectors around the world.
